history.content: I can only speak for the 5th Year Master's at Berkeley, but I P/NP'd all of my breadths and was admitted last year (in the program this school year). I imagine that the 5th Year Master's cares more for your technical and major GPA.

children.subject:
I think the main consideration would be how taking the breadth for a grade would affect your cumulative GPA (directly) and your tech GPA (indirectly if you have to spend less time on your techs this semester to pull off the A- in your breadth). 

My understanding is that for non-tech classes, the schools won’t look at your exact grades, only your cumulative GPA. Major and tech GPA, and exact grades in tech classes are more significant.

Thanks!

Do you think a B on a breadth would impact my app negatively? I'm asking because I might be able to pull of an A-, but in the case that I don't I'd rather not risk it if breadths don't really matter anyways.

history.content:
Hi!

I was deciding whether or not it would be a good idea to P/NP my breadths, so I can focus more on my CS/tech classes. Does P/NPing breadth class generally look bad for grad school applications? If I don't P/NP my breadths and end up getting a B, will it affect my chances for grad school (particularly 5th years masters)? Please let me know if any of you had to make a similar decision, as I'm still very conflicted. Thanks so much!
history.subject: P/NP for 5th years Masters/Grad school in general
